text: Giuseppina Projetto-Frau (30 May 1902 - 6 July 2018) was an Italian supercentenarian who was the oldest living person in Europe after the death of Ana Mar√≠a Vela Rubio on 15 December 2017. She was also the oldest living person in Italy since the death of Marie Josephine Gaudette on 13 July 2017. Projetto was the oldest living person born in Italy since the death of Emma Morano on 15 April 2017, as Gaudette was born in the United States. Projetto was born in La Maddalena. In 1946, she married Giuseppe Frau, a widower with three children. Projetto lived in Tuscany with her daughter-in-law and grandchildren. She was the second oldest living person in the world after Chiyo Miyako, who died only 16 days after Projetto's death. She was the last person known to have been born in 1902. Projetto died on 6 July 2018 at the age of 116.Addio a Giuseppina Projetto, la nonna d'Europa: aveva 116 anni Giuseppina Projetto was succeeded as the Europe's oldest living person by Maria Giuseppa Robucci, also from Italy. == References == Category:1902 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Italian supercentenarians
title: Giuseppina Projetto
